On the Wednesday edition of Breitbart News Daily, broadcast live on SiriusXM Patriot Channel 125 from 6AM to 9AM Eastern, Breitbart Editor-in-Chief Alex Marlow will continue our discussion of the terror attack in Berlin, the assassination of the Russian Ambassador in Turkey, and the Christmas security lockdown throughout Europe, which sadly appears to be the new normal in a continent increasingly plagued by Islamist terror attacks.

Dan Gainor, the Vice President of Business and Culture at the Media Research Center, will discuss Hollywood’s post-election examination of bias, as entertainment executives ask themselves, “Are we telling the right stories?”

Bob Carey, Director of Military Affairs and Veterans Engagement for the RNC, will discuss Trump’s record-breaking support among veterans and the future of the VA and the military in Trump’s presidency.

Public Interest Law Professor John Banzhaf of George Washington University Law School will discuss a bill the North Carolina legislature is poised to pass that would rescind the state’s HB2 transgender bathroom legislation.

SiriusXM Vice President for news and talk Dave Gorab called the show “the conservative news show of record.”

Follow Breitbart News on Twitter for live updates during the show.
Marlow will also continue our analysis of the election of President-elect Donald Trump, the progress of his transition team, and his policy vision.
Live from London, Rome, and Jerusalem, Breitbart correspondents will provide updates on the latest international news.
Breitbart News Daily is the first live, conservative radio enterprise to air seven days a week.
He’ll be joined by Frank Gaffney, President of the Center for Security Policy.
Listeners may call into the show at: 866-957-2874.
